Value.label: Wake up 10 minutes on Power On
Value.Help: Enable/Disable waking up for 10 minutes when re-power on (battery mode) the MultiSensor

Value.label: On time
Value.Help: Duration that the motion sensor must observe no motion before it will return to the no-motion state. If value greater than 255, effective value is rounded up to the nearest minute (255 -> 255 seconds, 256 -> 300 seconds)

Value.label: Enable Motion Sensor
Value.Help: Enable Motion Sensor, (1 minimum, 5 maximum sensitivity level)

Value.label: Command Options
Value.Help: Which commands to send when PIR motion sensor triggered OZW Ideal Value is Binary Sensor Report

Value.label: Awake timeout
Value.Help: Set the timeout of awake after the Wake Up CC is sent out. Available rang: 8 to 255 seconds.

Value.label: Current power mode
Value.Help: Report the current power mode and the product state for battery power mode

Item.label: USB power, sleeping mode after re-power on
USB power, keep awake for 10 minutes after re-power on
Battery power, sleeping mode after re-power on
Battery power, keep awake for 10 minutes after re-power on

Value.label: Low Battery
Value.Help: Configure low battery value Value=10 to 50.

Value.label: Report Only On Thresholds
Value.Help: Enable/disable the selective reporting only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in the threshold settings. This is used to reduce network traffic.

Value.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is Fahrenheit for US version, Celsius for EU/AU version. 2. The value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the threshold value = 2.0 C (EU/AU) or 2.0 F (US). When the temperature has changed by 2.0 (of the appropriate unit), a temperature report will be sent.

Value.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in humidity will trigger a report.

Value.label: Luminance Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Battery Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report. Note: 1. The unit is %. 2. The default value is 10, which means that a 10% change in battery will trigger a report.

Value.label: UV Reporting Threshold
Value.Help: Threshold change in ultraviolet to induce an automatic report.

Value.label: Low Temp Alarm
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send the alarm report of low temperature(Less than 15 Degress C)

Value.label: Enable/disable to send a report on Threshold
Value.Help: Enable/disable to send a report when the measurement is more than the upper limit value or less than the lower limit value. Bit mask = 0, disable. Bit mask = 1, enable. Bit 0 = temperature. Bit 1 = humidity. Bit 2 = luminance. Bit 3 = ultraviolet. The above bit masks are used to enable/disable to send out a report when the measurement is less than the lower limit value. The below bit masks are used to enable/disable to send out a report when the measurement is more than the upper limit value. Bit 4 = temperature. Bit 5 = humidity. Bit 6 = luminance. Bit 7 = ultraviolet. Note: If USB power, the Sensor will check the limit every 10 seconds. If battery power, the Sensor will check the limit when it is waken up.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. High byte is the upper limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 1. When unit is Celsius. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 100.0 C (0xFE70 to 0x03E8). E.g. The default upper limit of EU/AU version is 28.0 C (0x0118), when the measurement is more than 28.0C, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report. 2. When unit is Fahrenheit. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 212.0 F (0xFE70 to 0x0848). E.g. The default upper limit of US version is 82.4F (0X0338), when the measurement is more than 82.4F, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. High byte is the lower limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 1. When unit is Celsius. Lower limit range: -40.0 to 100.0 C (0xFE70 to 0x03E8). E.g. The default lower limit of EU/AU version is 0 C (0x0000), when the measurement is less than 0C, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report. 2. When unit is Fahrenheit. Upper limit range: -40.0 to 212.0 F (0xFE70 to 0x0848). E.g. The default lower limit of US version is 32.0F (0x0140), when the measurement is less than 32.0F, it will be triggered to send out a temperature sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 0 to 100%. E.g. The default upper limit is 60%, when the measurement is more than 60%, it will be triggered to send out a humidity sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 0 to 100%. E.g. The default lower limit is 50%, when the measurement is less than 50%, it will be triggered to send out a humidity sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 0 to 30000 Lux. E.g. The default upper limit is 1000Lux, when the measurement is more than 1000Lux, it will be triggered to send out a Lighting sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this lower limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 0 to 30000 Lux. E.g. The default lower limit is 100Lux, when the measurement is less than 100Lux, it will be triggered to send out a Lighting sensor report.

Value.label: Set the upper limit value of ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is more than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Upper limit range: 1 to 11. E.g. The default upper limit is 8, when the measurement is more than 8, it will be triggered to send out a ultraviolet sensor report.

Value.label: Set the lower limit value of ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: When the measurement is less than this upper limit, which will trigger to sent out a sensor report. Lower limit range: 1 to 11. E.g. The default lower limit is 4, when the measurement is less than 8, it will be triggered to send out a ultraviolet sensor report.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of temperature sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that, the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that, the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. High byte is the recover limit value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius, 0x02=Fahrenheit). 4. Recover limit range: 1.0 to 25.5 C/ F (0x0101 to 0xFF01 or 0x0102 to 0xFF02). E.g. The default recover limit value is 2.0 C/F (0x1401/0x1402), when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 2), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 2), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of humidity sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal(Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Recover limit range: 1 to 50% (0x01 to 0x32). E.g. The default recover limit value is 5%, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 5), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 5), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of Lighting sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Unit = 10*Recover limit (Lux) 4. Recover limit range: 10 to 2550Lux (0x01 to 0xFF). E.g. The default recover limit value is 100 Lux, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 100), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 100), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Set the recover limit value of Ultraviolet sensor
Value.Help: Note: 1. When the current measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit), the upper limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is more than the upper limit. After that the upper limit report would be disabled again until the measurement lower or equal (Upper limit - Recover limit). 2. When the current measurement greater or equal (Lower limit + Recover limit), the lower limit report is enabled and then it would send out a sensor report when the next measurement is less than the lower limit. After that the lower limit report would be disabled again until the measurement greater or equal(Lower limit + Recover limit). 3. Recover limit range: 1 to 50% (0x01 to 0x32). E.g. The default recover limit value is 5%, when the measurement is less than (Upper limit - 5), the upper limit report would be enabled one time or when the measurement is more than (Lower limit + 5), the lower limit report would be enabled one time.

Value.label: Get the out-of-limit state of the Sensors
Value.Help: Get the out-of-limit state of the Sensors. Bit mask = 0, within the limit. Bit mask = 1, out of the limit. Bit 0 = temperature. Bit 1 = humidity. Bit 2 = luminance. Bit 3 = ultraviolet. The above bit masks are used to indicate whether the current measurements of the Sensors are out of the lower limit. The below bit masks are used to indicate whether the current measurements of the Sensors are out of the upper limit. Bit 4 = temperature. Bit 5 = humidity. Bit 6 = luminance. Bit 7 = ultraviolet.

Value.label: Temperature scale
Value.Help: Default value: Celsius for EU/AU version, Fahrenheit for US version.

Value.label: LED blinking report
Value.Help: Enable/disable the LED blinking for motion, wakeup, and sensor report.

Item.label: Disable LED blinking only when the PIR is triggered
Completely disable LED for motion, wakeup, and sensor report

Value.label: Reset Params 101-103 to Default
Value.Help: Reset The Reporting Group Configuration (101 to 103) to default

Value.label: Group 1 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 1. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Group 2 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 2. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Group 3 Reports
Value.Help: Which reports need to send automatically in timing intervals for group 3. Bitmask: 10000000 - 128 - Luminance 01000000 - 64 - Humidity 00100000 - 32 - Temperature 00010000 - 16 - Ultraviolet 00000001 - 1 - Battery 10100000 - 160 - Luminance and Temperature (32+128) 11110001 - 241 - All (1+16+32+64+128)

Value.label: Reset Params 111-113 to Default
Value.Help: Reset The Reporting Group Interval Configuration (111 to 113) to default

Value.label: Group 1 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 1. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Group 2 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 2. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Group 3 Interval
Value.Help: The interval for sending reports for group 3. The effective behavior of this setting depends on the device's power source: - If the device is on USB power, it will send the reports at the configured interval; set it to something low (~15-60 seconds) to get frequent updates from a powered device. - If the device is on battery, the sensor will never report in more often than its configured wake interval, regardless of what this setting is configured to; setting this to 3601 when the wake interval is 3600 would make this group report in every 7200 seconds. 240 seconds is the minimum wake interval, but will quickly use battery.

Value.label: Temperature Calibration
Value.Help: Temperature calibration (the available value range is [-128,127] or [-12.8C,12.7C]). Note: 1. High byte is the calibration value. Low byte is the unit (0x01=Celsius,0x02=Fahrenheit) 2. The calibration value (high byte) contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20 (0x1401), the calibration value is 2.0C (EU/AU version) or if the value is set to 20 (0x1402), the calibration value is 2.0F (US version) 3. The calibration value (high byte) = standard value - measure value. E.g. If measure value =25.3C and the standard value = 23.2C, so the calibration value= 23.2C - 25.3C= -2.1C (0xEB). If the measure value =30.1C and the standard value = 33.2C, so the calibration value= 33.2C - 30.1C=3.1C (0x1F). Default value: 1 for EU/AU version, 2 for US version.

Value.label: Humidity Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-50, 50]). If measure value =80RH and the standard value = 75RH, so the calibration value= 75RH-80RH = -5RH (0xFB). If the measure value =85RH and the standard value = 90RH, so the calibration value= 90RH-85RH = 5RH (0x05).

Value.label: Luminance Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value - measure value. (the available value range is [-1000, 1000]). If measure value =800Lux and the standard value = 750Lux, so the calibration value= 750-800 = -50 (0xFFCE). If the measure value =850Lux and the standard value = 900Lux, so the calibration value= 900-850 = 50 (0x0032).

Value.label: Ultraviolet Calibration
Value.Help: The calibration value = standard value measure value. (the available value range is [-10, 10]). If measure value =9 and the standard value = 8, so the calibration value= 8-9 = -1 (0xFE). If the measure value =7 and the standard value = 9, so the calibration value= 9-7 = 2 (0x02).

Value.label: Enable/disable Lock Configuration
Value.Help: Enable/disable Lock Configuration

Value.label: Reset To Factory Defaults
Value.Help: Reset to factory defaults

Item.label: Reset to factory default setting and removed from the z-wave network

Value.label: System Type
Value.Help: 0 = Standard, 1 = Heat Pump

Value.label: Fan Type
Value.Help: 0 = Gas (no fan w/Heat), 1 = Electric (Fan w/Heat)

Value.label: Change Over Type
Value.Help: 0 = w/Cool, 1 = w/Heat

Value.label: 2nd Stage Heat Enable
Value.Help: 0 = no 2nd stage heat, 1 = 2nd stage heat

Value.label: Aux Heat Enable
Value.Help: 0 = no aux heat, 1 = aux heat enabled

Value.label: 2nd Stage Cool Enable
Value.Help: 0 = no 2nd stage cool, 1 = 2nd stage cool

Value.label: Temperature Unit
Value.Help: 0 = Celsius, 1 = Fahrenheit

Value.label: Minimum Off Time
Value.Help: Sets the Minimum Off Time (MOT) delay before another heating/cooling cycle can begin

Value.label: Minimum Run Time
Value.Help: Sets the Minimum Run Time (MRT) delay before a heating/cooling cycle can turn of

Value.label: Setpoint H/C Delta
Value.Help: Sets the minimum separation between heating and cooling setpoints

Value.label: H Delta Stage 1 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating starts

Value.label: H Delta Stage 1 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating stops

Value.label: H Delta Stage 2 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating starts

Value.label: H Delta Stage 2 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delay from setpoint that stage 2 heating stops

Value.label: H Delta Aux ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating starts

Value.label: H Delta Stage 2 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating stops

Value.label: C Delta Stage 1 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling starts

Value.label: C Delta Stage 1 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling stops

Value.label: C Delta Stage 2 ON
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling starts

Value.label: C Delta Stage 2 OFF
Value.Help: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling stops

Value.label: Display Lock
Value.Help: Display Lock

Value.label: Backlight Timer
Value.Help: Sets the time from last button press that the backlight will turn OFF

Value.label: Max Heat Setpoint
Value.Help: Sets the maximum heating setpoint value

Value.label: Min Cool Setpoint
Value.Help: Sets the minimum cooling setpoint value

Value.label: Schedule Enable
Value.Help: Enable or disable thermostat's local scheduler

Value.label: Run/Hold Mode
Value.Help: 0 = Hold, 1 = Run

Value.label: Setback Mode
Value.Help: 0 = No setback, 2 = Un-occupied mode

Value.label: Un-Occupied HSP
Value.Help: Heat Setpoint for Unoccupied mode

Value.label: Un-Occupied CSP
Value.Help: Cool Setpoint for Unoccupied mode

Value.label: Remote Sensor 1 Node Number
Value.Help: Node number for Remote Sensor 1

Value.label: Remote Sensor 1 Temperature
Value.Help: Temperature of Remote Sensor 1

Value.label: Internal Sensor Temp Offset
Value.Help: Internal Sensor Temperature Offset

Value.label: R1 Sensor Temp Offset
Value.Help: R1 Sensor Temperature Offset

Value.label: Filter Timer
Value.Help: Timer to let know when to change or clean the filter

Value.label: Max Filter Timer
Value.Help: Maximum allowed value for filter timer

Value.label: Heat Timer
Value.Help: Heat Timer in hours

Value.label: Cool Timer
Value.Help: Cool Timer in hours

Value.label: Fan Purge Heat
Value.Help: Fan purge period for Heat mode

Value.label: Fan Purge Cool
Value.Help: Fan purge period for Cool mode

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the switch is lit.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: BASIC SET command
Value.Help: Enable/Disable BASIC SET command

Value.label: Value of the BASIC SET
Value.Help: Send BASIC SET VALUE = 255 to nodes associated with group 2 when door/window is opened. Send BASIC SET VALUE = 0 to nodes associated with group 2 when door/window is closed.

Value.label: Level of low battery
Value.Help: The value here defines the low battery

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: Overload protection.

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Choose the recovery state for your Power Switch if power outage occurs.

Value.label: On/Off Status Change Notifications
Value.Help: Send On/Off Status Change Notifications

Item.label: Sends notification if status is changed manually or remotely
Sends notification ONLY if status is changed manually

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: 0 - LED indicator will display power consumption whenever the device is plugged in. 1 - LED indicator will display the level of power consumption for 5 seconds only whenever the device is turned on or off

Item.label: Display whenever the device is plugged in (Default)

Value.label: Power Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: Number of Watts the appliance needs to go over for the change to be reported

Value.label: Power Report Percentage Threshold
Value.Help: Percentage in power usage change the appliance needs to go over for the event to be reported (Default 10)

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Voltage Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Electricity Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF

Item.label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Value.label: Associations command class choice
Value.Help: Choose which command classes are sent to associated devices.

Value.label: Outputs state change mode
Value.Help: Choose the behaviour of transitions between different levels.

Item.label: MODE 1 - Constant Speed (speed is defined by parameters 9 and 10)
MODE 2 - Constant Time (RGB/RBGW only. Time is defined by parameter 11)

Value.label: Dimming step value (for MODE 1)
Value.Help: Size of the step for each change in level during the transition.

Value.label: Time between dimming steps (for MODE 1)
Value.Help: Time between each step in a transition between levels. Setting this to zero means an instantaneous change.

Value.label: Time to complete the entire transition (for MODE 2)
Value.Help: 0 - immediate change; 1->63: 20ms->126ms (value*20ms); 65->127: 1s->63s (value-64)*1s; 129->191: 10s->630s (value-128)*10s; 193->255: 1min->63min (value-192)*1min. Default setting: 67 (3s)

Value.label: Maximum dimmer level
Value.Help: Maximum brightness level for the dimmer

Value.label: Minimum dimmer level
Value.Help: Minimum brightness level for the dimmer

Value.label: Inputs / Outputs configuration
Value.Help: This is too complex to describe here, since this value is built up from 4-bits for each of the 4 channels. Refer to the table in the product manual. Default value is 4369 (1111 in hex).

Value.label: Option double click
Value.Help: Option double click (lighting set at 100%). 0 - Double click disabled, 1 - Double click enabled. Default setting 1

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Alarm
Value.Help: Alarm of any type (general alarm, water flooding alarm, smoke alarm: CO, CO2, temperature alarm). Default setting 0 (Inactive)

Item.label: INACTIVE - no response to alarm frames
ALARM ON - the device turns on once alarm is detected (all channels set to 99%)
ALARM OFF - the device turns off once alarm is detected (all channels set to 0%)
ALARM PROGRAM - alarm sequence turns on (program selected in parameter 38)

Value.label: Alarm sequence program
Value.Help: Program number selected from the 10 available.

Value.label: Active PROGRAM alarm time
Value.Help: In ALARM PROGRAM mode (see parameter 30), this defines the time in seconds the program lasts (1s->65534s)

Value.label: Command class reporting Outputs status change
Value.Help: Specify which command class is used to report output status changes

Item.label: Reporting as a result of inputs and controllers actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
Reporting as a result inputs actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
Reporting as a result inputs actions (COLOUR_CONTROL)

Value.label: Reporting 0-10v analog inputs change threshold
Value.Help: Parameter defines a value by which input voltage must change in order to be reported to the main controller. New value is calculated based on last reported value: Default setting: 5 (0.5V). Range: 1->100 - (0.1V->10V).

Value.label: Power load reporting frequency
Value.Help: Sent if last reported value differs from the current value. Reports will also be sent in case of polling. Default setting: 30 (30s). Range: 1->65534 (1s->65534s) - interval between reports. Zero means reports are only sent in the case of polling, or at turning OFF the device

Value.label: Reporting changes in energy consumed by controlled devices
Value.Help: Interval between energy consumption reports (in kWh). New reported energy consumption value is calculated based on last reported value. 1->254 (0.01kWh->2.54kWh). Zero means changes in consumed energy will not be reported, except in case of polling.

Value.label: Response to BRIGHTNESS set to 0%
Value.Help: Set whether to remember the previous RGB mix after the brightness has fallen to zero (black)

Item.label: Illumination colour set to white (all channels controlled together)

Value.label: Starting predefined program
Value.Help: First predefined program to use when device is set to work in RGB/RGBW mode (parameter 14)

Value.label: Triple Click Action
Value.Help: Behaviour when an input is triple-clicked

Item.label: NODE INFO control frame is sent

Value.label: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF
Value.Help: Enable/Disable ALL ON/OFF

Item.label: ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled/ ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

Value.label: Associations command class choice
Value.Help: Choose which command classes are sent to associated devices.

Value.label: Outputs state change mode
Value.Help: Choose the behaviour of transitions between different levels.

Item.label: MODE 1 - Constant Speed (speed is defined by parameters 9 and 10)
MODE 2 - Constant Time (RGB/RBGW only. Time is defined by parameter 11)

Value.label: Dimming step value (for MODE 1)
Value.Help: Size of the step for each change in level during the transition.

Value.label: Time between dimming steps (for MODE 1)
Value.Help: Time between each step in a transition between levels. Setting this to zero means an instantaneous change.

Value.label: Time to complete the entire transition (for MODE 2)
Value.Help: 0 - immediate change; 1->63: 20ms->126ms (value*20ms); 65->127: 1s->63s (value-64)*1s; 129->191: 10s->630s (value-128)*10s; 193->255: 1min->63min (value-192)*1min. Default setting: 67 (3s)

Value.label: Maximum dimmer level
Value.Help: Maximum brightness level for the dimmer

Value.label: Minimum dimmer level
Value.Help: Minimum brightness level for the dimmer

Value.label: Inputs / Outputs configuration
Value.Help: This is too complex to describe here, since this value is built up from 4-bits for each of the 4 channels. Refer to the table in the product manual. Default value is 4369 (1111 in hex).

Value.label: Option double click
Value.Help: Option double click (lighting set at 100%). 0 - Double click disabled, 1 - Double click enabled. Default setting 1

Value.label: Saving state before power failure
Value.Help: Saving state before power failure

Item.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

Value.label: Alarm
Value.Help: Alarm of any type (general alarm, water flooding alarm, smoke alarm: CO, CO2, temperature alarm). Default setting 0 (Inactive)

Item.label: INACTIVE - no response to alarm frames
ALARM ON - the device turns on once alarm is detected (all channels set to 99%)
ALARM OFF - the device turns off once alarm is detected (all channels set to 0%)
ALARM PROGRAM - alarm sequence turns on (program selected in parameter 38)

Value.label: Alarm sequence program
Value.Help: Program number selected from the 10 available.

Value.label: Active PROGRAM alarm time
Value.Help: In ALARM PROGRAM mode (see parameter 30), this defines the time in seconds the program lasts (1s->65534s)

Value.label: Command class reporting Outputs status change
Value.Help: Specify which command class is used to report output status changes

Item.label: Reporting as a result of inputs and controllers actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
Reporting as a result inputs actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
Reporting as a result inputs actions (COLOUR_CONTROL)

Value.label: Reporting 0-10v analog inputs change threshold
Value.Help: Parameter defines a value by which input voltage must change in order to be reported to the main controller. New value is calculated based on last reported value: Default setting: 5 (0.5V). Range: 1->100 - (0.1V->10V).

Value.label: Power load reporting frequency
Value.Help: Sent if last reported value differs from the current value. Reports will also be sent in case of polling. Default setting: 30 (30s). Range: 1->65534 (1s->65534s) - interval between reports. Zero means reports are only sent in the case of polling, or at turning OFF the device

Value.label: Reporting changes in energy consumed by controlled devices
Value.Help: Interval between energy consumption reports (in kWh). New reported energy consumption value is calculated based on last reported value. 1->254 (0.01kWh->2.54kWh). Zero means changes in consumed energy will not be reported, except in case of polling.

Value.label: Response to BRIGHTNESS set to 0%
Value.Help: Set whether to remember the previous RGB mix after the brightness has fallen to zero (black)

Item.label: Illumination colour set to white (all channels controlled together)

Value.label: Starting predefined program
Value.Help: First predefined program to use when device is set to work in RGB/RGBW mode (parameter 14)

Value.label: Triple Click Action
Value.Help: Behaviour when an input is triple-clicked

Item.label: NODE INFO control frame is sent
